args.query: ContractibleSpace HomotopyGroup trivial homotopy groups ContractibleSpace ConnectedSpace HomotopyGroup mathlib

result: {"ok": true, "results": [{"nl": "For any category \\( C \\) enriched with zero morphisms, given two homological complexes \\( K \\) and \\( L \\) over a complex shape \\( c \\), a morphism \\( f \\) from \\( K \\) to \\( L \\), and an index \\( i \\) for which both \\( K \\) and \\( L \\) have homology, if the homology of the subcomplex \\( (K.sc \\, i) \\) at \\( i \\) is zero, then prove that the homology map induced by \\( f \\) at \\( i \\) being an isomorphism implies the homology of the su

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Every contractible space is connected and has trivial homotopy groups. -/
theorem contractible_space_connected_and_trivial_homotopy_groups {X : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X]
  (h : ContractibleSpace X) :
  ConnectedSpace X ∧ ∀ (N : Type _) (x : X), Subsingleton (HomotopyGroup N X x) := by
  sorry
